title: Accessing Ubuntu 24 using the "Remote Login" feature
author: raffaeler
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->
I tested Ubuntu24 new "Remote Login" feature successfully using Windows RDP client. Basically, there are two sets of credentials.
- with the first credential set (which can be specified in the "Remote Login" dialog, the Windows RDP client accesses Ubuntu remote login screen.
- The second set of credentials matches the Ubuntu user, as if you were trying to access from the main (physical) PC

comments.author: TangentFoxy
comments.snippet:
Getting the same output as EmeraldFlame.. :\ 
I also can confirm that using Microsoft's Remote Desktop Connection is working fine so it's not a server error.

comments.author: MellowedMatt
comments.snippet: Just wanted to add myself to the folks encountering this issue. Connecting through desktop sharing works fine, but Remote Login fails exactly as EmeraldFlame reports. Connecting through the Windows 11 RDP client works as expected.

comments.author: GlennIgen
comments.snippet:
I have done some testing and can confirm that it's a similar issue on Fedora, latest version (41 Workstation Edition).

It is possible to make it work if you change the resolution to either fullscreen or a fixed resolution.
It's also possible to start in fullscreen, then minimize it to a tab, right-click the tab, and select SmartSize (though the image will appear blurry).

Personally, I just set the resolution to be slightly smaller than the actual window, so I get some gray borders. ðŸ˜Š
